title: The False Unification Protocol
outcome: The Council claims to unify the city by forcing all free zone councils into a central registry. Directorate agents try to enforce order using outdated BCI labor assignments. Free zones push back with nonviolent resistance and exposure of the Council’s overreach. The resulting standoff triggers mass rejection of both the BCI and Council legitimacy, as symbols of old authority are publicly discarded.

events.description: Council broadcasts a 'Unified Civic Charter' and orders all free zone councils to register with the Directorate. Citywide, citizens are mandated to display old BCI credentials.
Directorate enforcement squads, relying on outdated BCI labor lists, forcibly reassign residents to former jobs and deny local councils the right to organize independently.
Free zone leaders document and publicize evidence that many councils never agreed to the Charter, fueling outrage and calls for mass renunciation of BCI authority.
Citizens conduct 'Renunciation Days,' publicly discarding and burning BCI tokens and refusing further participation in Council-mandated registrations.
Stalemate sets in as free zones operate openly outside Council control, and BCI compliance drops to historic lows, leaving the system's future in deeper doubt.
